article_title: Broadcom Aims to Sell Chips Supporting All Chinese Telecom Carriers
article_text:
SHANGHAI—Broadcom Corp. is looking to expand its sales in China by making chips that support a wider range of handsets, including those that run on the network of the world's largest telecom carrier, China Mobile Inc.

Broadcom's strategy is a bet that demand will continue to rise for low-cost smartphones that work on China Mobile's third-generation network. It also comes at a time when China is spending heavily to reduce its...

SHANGHAI—Broadcom Corp. is looking to expand its sales in China by making chips that support a wider range of handsets, including those that run on the network of the world's largest telecom carrier, China Mobile Inc.Broadcom's strategy is a bet that demand will continue to rise for low-cost smartphones that work on China Mobile's third-generation network.
